𒆬 ≈ 𒌋𒍝 ≈ 𒍝𒌋 ≈ 𒄩 KU₆ KUᴿ 𒆬 KU₃ KÙ KUʳ ков kov Kupfer copper cured cooked metal 𒆬 4 𓊋 𒆬 KUG < quick queck in ☿ 𒆬 KUG > •keuĝ = keusch "chaste" чы́сты čýsty "pure" 𒆬 KUG χαλκός khalkós chuqi q'illay <> cook "metal" 𒆬 KUˡᵏ χαλκός khalkós gold culbar silber < KUʳ 𒆬 KUᵒⁿ 纯 chún clean cured "pure" 𒆬 KUG ≈ 𓂦 𓂋 in 𒆬𒅅 kug-ĝal₂ kugĝal 𓆓 𓋴 𓂋 𓂦 sacral 𒆬 KUG > ἅγιος hágio heilig "holy" 𒆬 KU ቅዱስ ḳədus קדוש ka'dosh "holy" 𒆬 ≈ 𓋞 Kyros круше́ц krušéc "metal, gold" 𓐍 𓋴 𓋞 χρύσεος KÙ.GI 𒆬𒄀

𒀀𒋡𒊒 a-qa-ru 𓋨 / 𓀻 𓋴 𓋴 𓏛 𓏥
𒀀𒋡𒊒 precious , to be(come) rare
𒀀𒋡𒊒 a-qa-ru ≠ accurate ⇔ 𒋡𒀭𒍝𒁀𒊏

In general the caspian region of the Caucasus seems namesake for precious metals and stones.

𓎡 𓈙 𓈉 Kush

כספי kaspí silvery => הים הכספי “Caspian sea”
The traditional Arabic name for the sea is Baḥr Qazwin,
In Persian since the Persian middle age, Iran is generally known as درياى خزر, Daryā-e Khazar.
This names it after the Khazars, an ancient Turkic nomadic, local tribe (Χάζαροι, כוזרים, Kuzarim, 葛薩 Gésà, Toquz Oghuz 𐱃𐰸𐰆𐰔:𐰆𐰍𐰔 Turks ⇔ Kazakh)
in Turkmen: Hazar deňizi
in Azerbaijani: Xəzər dənizi
in modern Turkish: Hazar denizi.

Hussar ⇔ Caspian? long branches :(
